alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 9:55AM CDT until April 05 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. .Heavy rain over the weekend fell on a deep primed snowpack, resulting in increased snowmelt and runoff. Rivers are expected to crest in the next 1 to 2 days before slowly falling through the week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 47.0 feet, Some rural roads may begin to flood including county Highway VV downstream near the La Crosse County line. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 47.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Monday was 48.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 47.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 47.0 feet on 03/30/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM CDT.
